reviewText:
Disclaimer: I got the game from the dev with a key in order to put it on my channel.

The Dev asked me to put a positive review on here, so here goes...

Positive: The game is better than trapping your genitals in your zipper. From my experience at least.

That's where it ends I'm afraid. I will sum it up in as few words as possible.

The game is clunky as hell, there doesn't actually seem to be any form of plot. The voice acting is worse than mine. The graphics are like something you would have been slightly disapointed by 10 years ago.

Should you buy it? No. You shouldn't.

Check out the game here: (did I sell it well?)

reviewText:
You're a special forces soldier who seems more interested in his secret crush for his General rather than fighting against the aliens invading Earth: once you've stopped drooling over him you'll be going through several missions where you'll be trying to turn the tide of the war.
Battle for the Sun is a very basic and dull FPS with a gameplay that can be summed up as sprint through bare levels/ shoot a few aliens while getting in cover whenever needed/ look for the next waypoint/ rinse and repeat.

PROS:

-cutscenes are unintentionally funny in a so bad/ cheesy it's good" way

CONS:

-bad graphics
hoursPlayed: lights clip through objects and models look lifeless\n\n-embarassing animations
voteText: walking characters seem to be sliding around and their feet will sometimes clip through each other: enemies killed while prone will also sometimes stand up before doing their death animation\n\n-terrible sound
votesHelpful: voice acting is bad and suffers from awful recording quality\n\n-barebones story and what little can be found is cliched and badly written
votesTotal: most missions even lack an explanation on why you're doing what you're doing\n\n-actual gameplay is poor
votesFunny: weapons are overpowered and extremely precise (even shotguns kill from half a level away)
commentsCount: grenades and rpgs have an huge area of effect
column16: aliens are only effective due to homing shots
column17:
large areas between alien encounters are just boring to navigate

-basic AI can even have problems navigating stairs or reacting to enemies on different heights

-dull
column18:
repetitive level design

-beeped out swearing is as silly as it sounds

-tacked on "skill system" has little to no effect on actual gameplay

-extremely short
column19:
took me less than an hour and a half

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=661342658

Battle for the Sun is at least good for a laugh if you got it for free like me
column20: the cutscenes and dialogues alone are so bad and silly- as if they were written by a young overexcited teen- to easily make you laugh. Seriously
column21: just look them up online. Sadly that's all there's to it as once you're done laughing at how terrible everything is you're still left with an hour long game to play through
column22: if you're so inclined.\n\nGunplay is bad
column23: shotgun trumps everything basically as it can headshot and one shot kill aliens from miles away: on the other hand aliens are extremely weak so the devs decided to give them homing shots that follow the player and can also curve through corners if you dont sidestep fast enough. But don't be worried
column24: if you die you'll restart at the last checkpoint and everything you've killed stays dead so there's basically no challenge whatsoever or penalties for dying. Moving on sounds are bad
column25: voice actors seem to have worked using a potato for a recorder
column26: the skill system does absolutely nothing and the lack of explanation for your objectives makes every mission an uninteresting chore...why am I gathering boxes in a cave? why am I destroying that purple sphere? no one knows.\n\nEven though it can be good for a chuckle if you happen to own it there's no real reason for you to buy this game as there's nothing fun to be found here: even if you can stomach most of the Cons I've listed the game is simply boring and dull."

reviewText: An epic of unmatched scale! In Battle for the Sun you foster an unrequited love affair with your mentor General Briggs, as you fend off the assault from space gremlins and other Unity assets. With a complex skill tree to follow and levels that are 12 Kilometers in scale, there's so much replay potential. Hopefully the developers release the one (1) multiplayer map they promised. They should probably also release a multiplayer client to play that map on as well. I won't ruin the plot, but the credits indicate that five seperate people contributed to its creation. All in all, amazing work of interactive fiction. Did you hear about South Dury?" Yes
date: yes I did General Briggs. The Citizen Kane of video games is finally here."

reviewText: I came for the battle and stayed for the Sun. But really, this is a mediocre game at best. However, it's a great game where you can smoke up something or drink a little too much and definitely have some fun. Really, some of the parts are unintentionally funny, and the game is worth it for that alone. There's always something enjoyable about playing something that you know is not the best thing ever, and yet you can't stop playing. But that's just me, I enjoy playing games that are bad" as bad games are still entertaining."

reviewText:
To me, this is just another average shooter. Right down the middle lane of mediocrity. There is some charm in it, as almost everything is some sort of parody of other shooters.

As far the gameplay goes, it's pretty bland. The GUI seems like it came from the 90s of PC gaming, and the gameplay itself is like a HL1 mod with no real sense of direction.

But why do I like it just enough? Like I said, there's a bit a charm in the amateurish voice acting. If the devs spent $10 on a pop filter, it would've improved by 100%. The gameplay also has a sort of retro charm, like back when I was a kid and I would literally play any FPS that came my way.

If you're into that kind of thing, get it. If you want to go crazy on your YT channel and make a fun video, get it. If anything, wait for it to come on sale to grab it.

I give it a solid 6/10. Down the middle.

reviewText: It's not good but also it's not that bad, For the price and that it's a rare FPS shooter that runs on linux, it's kind of ok as long as your not expecting call of duty, It's more Pain Killer/Serious Sam with out the AAA quality, For an indie game made from Unity 3D it's frame rate and gameplay mechanics work well, ok the voice acting, 3d models and animation are a major let down but again this is not an AAA game, the game level wise are big and long so graphics are minimal but do the job, Oh and it's hard, really hard, but thankfully you have infinite lifes and respawn not far away and the aliens you have killed are still dead, Also have not found one single bug or game breaker so far, so forget the story and remember it's an indie game and like me just have some fun.

reviewText:
Battle For The Sun is a fun-to-play atmospheric game with a retro-modern vibe.

The game itself looks visually pleasing, the controls are robust and the storyline is supported with good voice acting. One of the best points of the game is its checkpoint system -- they are scattered very close together, so if you end up losing a life you can get straight back into action with little delay!

Overall, I would recommend this game to FPS fans and casual gamers alike!

reviewText:
I have found redeeming qualities in games like Chernobyl Commando which was panned by critics and gamers alike, so I tought that this game would be good enough if I paid a fair price for it.

Guess what happened; Even with its budget price the game is not worth, it's hardly playable, horrible to look at, uninteresting, I asked Steam for refund.

When you can't play a game for more than 5 minutes, then something is wrong with it, this is what happened with this game.

DON'T PLAY THIS GAME!!!
